keyword: how many calories are in a spoon of sugar
title: How Many Calories Are in a Spoon of Sugar?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a spoon of sugar, including carbs, sugars, and nutrition facts based on a standard teaspoon serving.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Spoon of Sugar?
assumptions: Assuming 1 teaspoon (tsp) of granulated white sugar, approximately 4 g; spoons can vary, but teaspoon is standard for sugar measurements.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type, granule size, packing density, and spoon size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of granulated sugar provides about 16 calories, all from simple carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use powdered sugar (slightly denser per teaspoon)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a spoon of sugar?
faqs.a: About 16 calories for one teaspoon of granulated sugar.

faqs.q: Is a spoon of sugar the same as a teaspoon?
faqs.a: Typically yes for recipes, but tablespoons hold three times more (about 48 calories).

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a spoon of sugar?
faqs.a: 4 grams of carbohydrates, all as sugars, with no fiber or protein.

faqs.q: Does sugar type affect calories per spoon?
faqs.a: Minimal difference; white, brown, or powdered sugar is around 16 kcal per teaspoon.

faqs.q: How much sugar is too much daily?
faqs.a: Health guidelines suggest limiting added sugars to under 25-36 g per day for adults.
